headers.subject: Re: more annotations
headers.original-received: from ktown.kde.org ([131.246.103.200]) by ciao.gmane.org with smtp (Exim 4.43) id 1E7JxT-00046S-On for gckdq-quanta-devel-94@gmane.org; Mon, 22 Aug 2005 23:35:55 +0200
from relay1.zappmobile.ro (80.97.176.4) by ktown.kde.org with SMTP; 22 Aug 2005 21:35:51 -0000

body.para: On Monday 22 August 2005 15:34, Jens Herden wrote:

quote.quotepara: - in the All Files tab you do not move the cursor to the location of the annotation when the location is in the current document. If it is not the current document you open or switch and then you move the cursor. I think it should do this in any case.

body.para: I don't see a problem. Here it jump to the line in all cases: - if the document is not yet opened - if the document is opened, but not the current - if the document is opened and it's the current one.

quote.quotepara: - switching between annotation tabs does not preserve the tree status in the All Files tab. Everytime I go to this tab the tree is collapsed, even if I left it in an open state. Is this avoidable?

body.footer: -- Quanta Plus developer - http://quanta.kdewebdev.org K Desktop Environment - http://www.kde.org
